Get UK Administrative Boundaries

Source: R/get_sf.R
read_admin.Rd

read_admin fetches Administrative Boundaries from the ONS Open Geography Portal.

read_admin(
  geog,
  year = 2019,
  nations = c("E", "S", "W", "N"),
  type = "BGC",
  crs = 4326
)

Arguments

geog

Type of administrative boundaries
year

Year (2018 or 2019)
nations

For Which UK nations (c("E","W","S","N"))
type

Boundary Clipping ("BGC", "BFC", "BFE" or "BUC")
crs

Coordinate Reference System (ESPG). It is recommend to use 4326 (World Geodetic System) or potentially 27700 (UK OS British National Grid)

Value

Output is...

Details

This function...

Examples

read_admin("NAT")
#> Simple feature collection with 4 features and 11 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -8.649996 ymin: 49.86474 xmax: 1.763706 ymax: 60.86078
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#>   objectid        cd               nm        ctry19nmw  bng_e  bng_n     long
#> 1        1 E92000001          England           Lloegr 394883 370883 -2.07811
#> 2        2 N92000002 Northern Ireland Gogledd Iwerddon  86544 535337 -6.85570
#> 3        3 S92000003         Scotland         Yr Alban 277744 700060 -3.97094
#> 4        4 W92000004            Wales            Cymru 263405 242881 -3.99417
#>        lat st_area.shape. st_length.shape.          country
#> 1 53.23497   130459836166         11957229          England
#> 2 54.61501    14330042878          1048413 Northern Ireland
#> 3 56.17743    78799932231         16985357         Scotland
#> 4 52.06741    20781773816          3022064            Wales
#>                         geometry

if (FALSE) {
read_admin("UTLA", nations = c("E","W"))
}
